##Apply by post

To apply for a trainee licence by post, download the application form and send it to the DSA. 

You’ll also need to send:

- a passport-sized photo with your ADI personal reference number on the back 
- the ‘instructor training declaration’ form to prove you have done 40 hours of training
- the ‘application for trainee licence: declaration of manager/owner’ form if it’s your first trainee licence

introduction:
Apply for a trainee licence to give driving lessons - you’ll need to have passed the approved driving instructor (ADI) part 2 test and have done at least 40 hours of training with a qualified ADI.

*[ADI]: Approved driving instructor
more_information:
It costs £140.

The online service is available from 6am to 11:30pm.

You will need:

- your online user ID from the Driving Standards Agency (DSA)
- your password

###Finishing your application

To finish your application you will need to send:

- a print out of the last screen
- a passport-sized photo with your ADI personal reference number on the back 
- the ‘instructor training declaration’ form to prove you have done 40 hours of training
- the ‘application for trainee licence: declaration of manager/owner’ form if it’s your first trainee licence

$D [Download ‘ADI 21T - Instruction training declaration’ form (PDF, 217KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/dsa-bl/dsa_adi_21t.pdf "Download ‘ADI 21T - Instruction training declaration’ form (PDF, 217KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

$D [Download ‘ADI 3L(MD) - Application for trainee licence: declaration of manager/owner’ form (PDF, 240KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/dsa-bl/dsa_adi_3lmd.pdf "Download ‘ADI 3L(MD) - Application for trainee licence: declaration of manager/owner’ form (PDF, 240KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

^ There's a different process to [apply for a trainee licence](http://www.dvtani.gov.uk/adi/traineelicence.asp "Apply for a trainee licence"){:rel="external"} in Northern Ireland. ^

*[ADI]: Approved driving instructor
*[DSA]: Driving Standards Agency
